List database IDs

Source: R/general-get-tools.R
list_db_ids.Rd

Return a vector of all IDs in a database.

list_db_ids(db = "nucleotide")

Arguments

db

character, database name

Value

vector of characters

Details

Warning: can return very large vectors for large databases.

See also

Other get: gb_definition_get, gb_fasta_get, gb_organism_get, gb_record_get, gb_sequence_get, gb_version_get, is_in_db

Examples

library(restez)
restez_path_set(filepath = tempdir())
#> ... Creating '/tmp/RtmpQIbJmr/restez'
#> ... Creating '/tmp/RtmpQIbJmr/restez/downloads'
demo_db_create(n = 10)
# Warning: not recommended for real databases
#  with potentially millions of IDs
all_ids <- list_db_ids()


# What shall we do with these IDs?
# ... how about make a mock fasta file
seqs <- gb_sequence_get(id = all_ids)
defs <- gb_definition_get(id = all_ids)
# paste together
fasta_seqs <- paste0('>', defs, '\n', seqs)
fasta_file <- paste0(fasta_seqs, collapse = '\n')
cat(fasta_file)
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_1
#> caagcactca
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_2
#> gacgtcctgg
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_3
#> tggtgtacat
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_4
#> tagattccgc
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_5
#> aacacatcga
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_6
#> atggaacatc
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_7
#> tgtaaataca
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_8
#> tatggttgtt
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_9
#> cgcacggttt
#> >A demonstration sequence | id demo_10
#> ccccctatcg


# delete after example
db_delete()
#> NULL
